definition: doctrine (esp. religious)/argumentation (in a speech or essay)
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

pinyin: jian4 gou4 zheng4 yi4 li3 lun4

sentences.english: The other idea supporting instructional technology is the theory of progressivism.
sentences.chinese: 支持教育技術的另一個觀點是進步主義理論。

sentences.english: Dai Zhen was a unique scholar during the Qian- Jia time, who was expert at textual research and argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 戴震兼擅義理與考據，在乾嘉學術史上獨樹一幟。

sentences.english: Which should we accept: prioritarianism or utilitarianism?
sentences.chinese: 優先主義理論和功利主義理論，我們應接受哪個？

sentences.english: The principle enlightens us when we observe the operation of Nature.
sentences.chinese: 而這種義理是我們觀察自然運行得到的啓示。

sentences.english: Second, seen from the method of research, Neo-Confucianism is an " argumentative philosophy".
sentences.chinese: 其次，從研究方法看，道學是義理之學。

definition: to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
this life/to lose face/to be disgraced
to interpret and make glossaries and commentaries on classic texts
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
that being the case/then/in that case
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
